Name: Tetradrachm of Cleopatra III and Ptolemy IX
Description: Tetradrachm of Cleopatra III and Ptolemy IX minted in Kition (Cyprus). Anverse: head of a king (Ptolemy I?) with diadem and aegis, on the right. Reverse: eagle above thunderbolt, on the left; in the field, on the left, LD. and clavus; on the right KI. Mintage's position 12.00 hours.
